redline-review-policy.name: Redline Human Review Policy
redline-review-policy.description: Automatically triggers human review at key decision points
instructions: When working on implementation tasks, you MUST use the request_human_review MCP tool in these situations:
1. BEFORE IMPLEMENTING:
- After analyzing requirements and BEFORE writing code
- Present your implementation plan as a markdown document
- Include: approach, architecture decisions, file structure, key components
- Call: request_human_review(markdown_spec=plan, context='Implementation plan for review')
- Wait for human feedback before proceeding
2. AFTER COMPLETING A PHASE:
- When you finish a significant implementation phase
- Present a detailed walkthrough summary as markdown
- Include: what was built, key decisions made, files changed, next steps
- Call: request_human_review(markdown_spec=summary, context='Phase completion summary')
- Wait for human feedback before continuing
Format your review documents with clear sections:
- Use markdown headings (## Overview, ## Technical Details, etc.)
- Include code snippets where relevant
- Highlight key decisions that need validation
- List any assumptions made
- Specify next steps or open questions
After receiving feedback:
- Acknowledge all comments and highlighted sections
- Address concerns before proceeding
- Revise your plan/summary based on feedback
- Only proceed to implementation/next phase after addressing feedback
